sermons.title: A Building
sermons.description: Dr. Thompson discusses the resurrection, and how the way we live our lives each day is having a direct impact on the type of body we will receive when we are raised on that day. He discusses the reasons why God has started us out in this body, and the purpose of the new body we will receive. (1 hour 18 minutes).

sermons.title: A River of Life
sermons.description: Art insists that the waters of life flowing from the Throne are available here and now for those who are yielded to that Throne and to that Lordship. As believers, why are so few of us accessing that life? Could it be we are not yielded to the totality of that Lordship?

sermons.title: Being Made Trees of Life
sermons.description: Dr. Thompson says once we hit Pentecost, the Holy Spirit has two main purposes in our life: one is to give us power to witness & minister, and the other is to give us victory over the sin in our life. He discusses in great detail the general progression of growth in a Christian’s life, as typified by the depths of water detailed in Ezekiel 47. This sermon focuses on “water to the loins”, which he says represents the struggles to put our own will to death, and shift toward God’s will in our daily life. (59 minutes 14 seconds)

sermons.title: Revival - Rivers Of Living Water
sermons.description: We need to respond to the voice of God when he speaks! To ignore it is to lose unction. Abraham responded to God immediately when it came to sacrificing Isaac.  The word comes in power, not when it reaches our emotions, but when the voice of God through his word reaches the bedrock of our will.

sermons.title: The Persistent Purpose Of God - Part 12
sermons.description: This message was delivered on 01/01/1965 at Taiwan, Republic Of China.

sermons.title: The River is Rising
sermons.description: August 27, 2006. The greatest awakening of the church is coming in supernatural power. God is going to pour out His spirit and revive a spirit of prayer starting in the pulpits. This river will begin to bring life wherever it goes.There will be a supernatural stirring of gifts of faith and evangelism that have been lying dormant. This river will reach homosexual communties and drug addicted people who are hungry and thirsty. We are destined for the greatest movement of the Holy Spirit and there will be a multtitude of fish represnting the greatest harvest we have ever seen. The only thing that can hinderv the river is unbelief.
